page.title: 15A FARMER'S WIFE'S DAY
page.content: The men rise about{6.45}for early jobs of feeding animals and milking the house cow. The wife rises about {7.30,}calls the children and prepares breakfast. The chidren are taken to school or to catch the school bus. The hens and cats are fed, and household chores begun. Housework and cooking fill a lot of time, with interruptions for coffee and visiting travellers. There are generally{three meals}to be cooked a day. Teas are often taken out to fields in haytime. Some farmer's wives help with{tractor {work}and animals, and all who drive collect spare parts and do messages for the farm. They pay bills and shop when collecting children, and do {bookwork}in the evening.{Decorating the house and{gardening}are wife's work.
